Stage 3 is an unloading phase resulting in distal progradation of sediment when accommodation became available in the distal foredeep. This explains the attenuated but similar stratigraphy. The third-order sequence began to fine upwards, terminating in the argillaceous Elandsberg and Palingkloof members (FigsÂ 2 and 3). This sequence was overprinted by climatic changes during the onset of the PTME
55 as indicated by paleoclimatic changes and a newly identified faunal turnover. Stage 4 marks the beginning of deposition of the early Triassic lower Katberg Formation during a new orogenic loading phase.
